title: Shell hook wrappers appear unused by Claude settings
description: Claude hook configuration invokes JavaScript hooks but shell wrapper variants remain; if the CLI no longer references the .sh wrappers, this is redundant and can drift.

steps: Confirm whether any environments still call the .sh wrappers.
If unused, remove the .sh wrappers or mark them as deprecated in HOOKS.md.

title: Audit S0/S1 validator missing on Edit/MultiEdit hooks
description: The PostToolUse hook config runs audit-s0s1-validator.js only for Write events, so editing audit JSONL files can bypass S0/S1 validation.
evidence: audit-s0s1-validator.js absent from Edit and MultiEdit hooks

steps: Add audit-s0s1-validator.js to the Edit and MultiEdit PostToolUse hook lists.
Optionally scope it to docs/audits/**/.jsonl to reduce unnecessary runs.
verification: Edit an audit JSONL file and confirm the validator runs

title: lint-staged only runs Prettier (no ESLint auto-fix)
description: lint-staged is configured to run only Prettier, leaving ESLint auto-fixable issues unresolved during pre-commit.

steps: Extend lint-staged to run eslint --fix on JS/TS files before Prettier.
Keep Prettier for non-code files (json/css/md) to avoid conflicts.

title: Pre-commit skips lint-staged when node_modules missing
description: The pre-commit hook skips lint-staged when the devDependency is not installed, so auto-formatting does not run on fresh clones without node_modules.
evidence: pre-commit checks npm list lint-staged and skips if not found
Prints warning but does not block commit

steps: Document a one-time bootstrap command (npm ci) in DEVELOPMENT.md/CONTRIBUTING.
Optionally fall back to npm exec lint-staged when node_modules are absent.
verification: Clone repo without node_modules and run a commit to verify

title: MCP servers are defined only in template config
description: The SessionStart MCP availability check requires .mcp.json, but the repo only ships mcp.json.example. Without a real .mcp.json, MCP inventory will report no servers configured.

steps: Document setup steps to copy mcp.json.example to .mcp.json and fill secrets.
verification: Create .mcp.json and confirm SessionStart reports available MCP servers
